headline.main: Men, Losing Out on Health Care (7 Letters)
headline.print_headline: Men, Losing Out on Health Care

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''The Weaker Sex'' (Op-Ed, June 17): Marianne J. Legato didn't go far enough when she posed the question of whether men are ''simply conditioned to be silent in the face of discomfort, sadness or fear.''

headline.main: Men, Losing Out on Health Care

docs.abstract: Seven letters comment on Marianne J Legato June 17 Op-Ed article on gender-specific medicine for men; C J Kingsley says unease in health care for both sexes results from lack of social equality; Miles Groth says men and boys are more susceptible to illness because they are reluctant to seek health care; Sumita Pahwa says it is girls who have less resistance to diseases than boys; Cinzia Padovani says she found support in Legato's detailed account of men's biological vulnerability; Thomas J Licata says health care industry may cater to women over men because women purchase more health services over longer period of time; Frank L Hill says greatest threat to men's health is war; Dimitra Arlys says neither gender is stronger or weaker, that they are equal; drawing
docs.snippet: To the Editor:     Re ''The Weaker Sex'' (Op-Ed, June 17):     Marianne J. Legato didn't go far enough when she posed the question of whether men are ''simply conditioned to be silent in the face of discomfort, sadness or fear.''

docs.lead_paragraph: Toxoplasma gondii infects over half the world's population. Scientists are now discovering some of the secrets of the parasite's success.

docs.lead_paragraph: The West Nile Virus and Lyme disease are at their worst in the summer, but both are less of a threat than asthma.

docs.lead_paragraph: The sun, heat and even air-conditioning can intensify symptoms of certain autoimmune diseases and cause problems that linger for months, if not years.

docs.lead_paragraph: The most surprising plan to reduce smoking may just be one backed by a tobacco executive.
